00001 // This file includes support for handling Intel Pin data types and and
00002 // other required code to support Intel Pin within ROSE.
00003 
00004 #include "rose.h"
00005 // #include "IntelPinSupport.h"
00006 
00007 // Later we can sue ROSE_ASSERT if appropriate.
00008 #include <assert.h>
00009 
00010 using namespace std;
00011 
00012 // Use the namespace defined in Pin (required fix to pin.H)
00013 using namespace LEVEL_PINCLIENT;
00014 
00015 
00016 string output (IMG_TYPE image_type)
00017    {
00018   // Outputs a string with the image enum type (for display)
00019 
00020      string s;
00021      switch (image_type)
00022         {
00023           case IMG_TYPE_STATIC:      s = "IMG_TYPE_STATIC";      break;
00024           case IMG_TYPE_SHARED:      s = "IMG_TYPE_SHARED";      break;
00025           case IMG_TYPE_SHAREDLIB:   s = "IMG_TYPE_SHAREDLIB";   break;
00026           case IMG_TYPE_RELOCATABLE: s = "IMG_TYPE_RELOCATABLE"; break;
00027 
00028           default:
00029              {
00030                printf ("Error: default reached in switch image_type = %u \n",image_type);
00031                assert(false);
00032              }
00033         }
00034 
00035      return s;
00036    }
00037

00039 string output (SEC_TYPE section_type)
00040    {
00041   // Outputs a string with the section enum type (for display)
00042 
00043      string s;
00044      switch (section_type)
00045         {
00046           case SEC_TYPE_INVALID:            s = "SEC_TYPE_INVALID";    break;
00047           case SEC_TYPE_UNUSED:             s = "SEC_TYPE_UNUSED";     break;
00048           case LEVEL_CORE::SEC_TYPE_REGREL: s = "SEC_TYPE_REGREL";     break;
00049           case LEVEL_CORE::SEC_TYPE_DYNREL: s = "SEC_TYPE_DYNREL";     break;
00050           case LEVEL_CORE::SEC_TYPE_EXEC:   s = "SEC_TYPE_EXEC";       break;
00051           case LEVEL_CORE::SEC_TYPE_DATA:   s = "SEC_TYPE_DATA";       break;
00052           case SEC_TYPE_DYNAMIC:            s = "SEC_TYPE_DYNAMIC";    break;
00053           case SEC_TYPE_OPD:                s = "SEC_TYPE_OPD";        break;
00054           case SEC_TYPE_GOT:                s = "SEC_TYPE_GOT";        break;
00055           case SEC_TYPE_STACK:              s = "SEC_TYPE_STACK";      break;
00056           case SEC_TYPE_PLTOFF:             s = "SEC_TYPE_PLTOFF";     break;
00057           case SEC_TYPE_HASH:               s = "SEC_TYPE_HASH";       break;
00058           case LEVEL_CORE::SEC_TYPE_LSDA:   s = "SEC_TYPE_LSDA";       break;
00059           case SEC_TYPE_UNWIND:             s = "SEC_TYPE_UNWIND";     break;
00060           case SEC_TYPE_UNWINDINFO:         s = "SEC_TYPE_UNWINDINFO"; break;
00061           case SEC_TYPE_REGSYM:             s = "SEC_TYPE_REGSYM";     break;
00062           case SEC_TYPE_DYNSYM:             s = "SEC_TYPE_DYNSYM";     break;
00063           case SEC_TYPE_DEBUG:              s = "SEC_TYPE_DEBUG";      break;
00064           case LEVEL_CORE::SEC_TYPE_BSS:    s = "SEC_TYPE_BSS";        break;
00065           case SEC_TYPE_SYMSTR:             s = "SEC_TYPE_SYMSTR";     break;
00066           case SEC_TYPE_DYNSTR:             s = "SEC_TYPE_DYNSTR";     break;
00067           case SEC_TYPE_SECSTR:             s = "SEC_TYPE_SECSTR";     break;
00068           case SEC_TYPE_COMMENT:            s = "SEC_TYPE_COMMENT";    break;
00069           case LEVEL_CORE::SEC_TYPE_LOOS:   s = "SEC_TYPE_LOOS";       break;
00070           case SEC_TYPE_LAST:               s = "SEC_TYPE_LAST";       break;
00071 
00072           default:
00073              {
00074                printf ("Error: default reached in switch section_type = %u \n",section_type);
00075                assert(false);
00076              }
00077         }
00078 
00079      return s;
00080    }
